definition: to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: That night I listen to sacred songs, not for apprehending, but for a delicate scent.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜我倾听梵歌，不为参悟，只为寻你一丝气息。

sentences.english: Sad that I had to go to Italy to realize that.
sentences.chinese: 可悲的是我居然要到意大利才能参悟到这个道理。

sentences.english: That night I listen to scared songs, not for apprehending, but for a delicate scent.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜我倾听梵唱，不为参悟，只为寻你一丝气息。

sentences.english: The creative process itself is also a form of self-cultivation and meditation.
sentences.chinese: 其间也是一个自我修炼和参悟的过程。

sentences.english: See a TV show that the state of actually taking.
sentences.chinese: 看了一部电视剧所参悟的境界而拍摄的。

sentences.english: Different people have different understanding towards the truth of Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 每个人对佛理的参悟都是不同的。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
to deduce/to infer/an implication/same as 推演
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
abstruse/profound mystery/the mysteries of the universe
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
